CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 23, 1958, pg. 2, reads: "Beaten With Blackjack - Before Alderman Harry B. Fitzgerald (right), John Minter Jr. (left) with the aid of his attorneys, Oliver L. and Livingstone M. Johnson (second and fourth from left), charged that he was handcuffed, beaten with a blackjack and placed in jail shortly after midnight, Aug. 2, by two Whitaker policemen who became angry because of a burned-out headlight on Minter's car. - Harris Photos."
TitMainTitle: John Minter Jr. on left with Attorneys Livingstone M. Johnson and Oliver L. Johnson, gathered before Alderman Harry B. Fitzgerald, for police brutality case against Whitaker police officers Robert S. Faucett and Raymond Hovan
